Only the left front (mode 0) offset changes when I turn the robot on. We will enter the event on Tuesday, please help.

We use MK4 364’code with Navx. my code is here. GitHub - wusled/gul2: da

Can you tell me where to make changes in my code? Pls help

Your project is using WPILib 2023. If you have competition tomorrow, updating to 2024 should be your top priority!

As far your initial problem, it would be helpful if you could describe what you’re seeing.

Are the magnets glued in? If the offset is actually changing, it’s probably because the magnet is spinning.

hi. code here for 2024

GitHub

GitHub - wusled/gul3

Contribute to wusled/gul3 development by creating an account on GitHub.

explanation: I adjust all offsets of the robot. When I turn the robot off and on, the front left (mode 0) angle changes by about 90 degrees.

I checked the magnets, they are stuck .
by the way
Our competition is on March 19th. please help me

I’m having a little trouble understanding your statement of the problem. A good problem report should explain three things: what you did, what you expected to happen, and what happened instead.

I took a quick look at your code. This may not be your problem, but I couldn’t find anywhere where you were setting the module angle PID to be periodic (say using setPositionPIDWrappingEnabled, setPositionPIDWrappingMinInput, and setPositionPIDWrappingMaxInput). Perhaps you’re compensating for that by using OnboardModuleState.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T13:49:53.641Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":46,"readers_count":45,"score":9.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":458369,"topic_slug":"mk4-offset-changing-only-mod-0","display_username":"Gavin Matthews","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://codedocs.revrobotics.com/java/com/revrobotics/sparkpidcontroller#setPositionPIDWrappingEnabled(boolean)","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"SparkPIDController (FRC-REVLib API)","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":61218,"username":"wusti","name":null,"avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/9fc29f/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38743,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)"},"post_url":"/t/mk4-offset-changing-only-mod-0/458369/4","custom_user_title":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3331080,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T14:50:04.345Z","cooked":"

You may be experiencing the known issue with CTRE’s Phoenix 5. When CANCoders boot, they don’t immediately report the correct absolute position. If your code starts up too fast, you’ll get incorrect data. There are two ways to deal with this, if it’s what you’re running into:

  1. You can fix this problem by upgrading to CTRE’s Phoenix 6 library, and using their waitForUpdate() feature. In your resetToAbsolute() method, you can wait for data to arrive from the CANCoder. This way you’re guaranteed to have valid data, or an error.
var position = encoder.getAbsolutePosition().waitForUpdate(0.2);
if (position.getError() != StatusCode.OK) {
  // You got an error, decide what to do
}
  1. You can attempt to work around the problem by putting a 1 second sleep in your initialization code to give the CANCoder a moment to start up. If you stay on Phoenix 5, you should also configure the CANCoder’s initializationStrategy to BootToAbsolutePosition

I set the offsets correctly on my robot, then when I turn the robot off and on, only the angle of the front left wheel changes. Very interestingly, sometimes it does not change.
Where should I write the commands you mentioned in my code?
I’m very new to swerve bot and I’m not familiar with commands. please help me.
